content.title: Axillary Artery Exposure
content.description: Surgical exposure of the axillary artery

key_concepts.details: Pectoralis major and minor may require division
Medial to coracoid process; axillary vein lies anterior
Brachial plexus cords surround the artery - avoid injury

content.clinical_significance: Required for proximal upper extremity procedures
content.statement: Axillary Artery Exposure is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Procedures that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Axillary Artery Exposure helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Axillary Artery Exposure include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Axillary Artery Exposure.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Axillary Artery Exposure. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
